verses.verse: Do we begin <S%G756><s%> again <S%G3825><s%> to commend <S%G4921><s%> ourselves? <S%G1438><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> <S%G3361><s%> need <S%G5535><s%> we, as some <S%G5100><s%> others, letters <S%G1992><s%> of commendation <S%G4956><s%> to you, or <S%G2228><s%> letters of commendation <S%G4956><s%> from you?
You are our letter <S%G1992><s%> written <S%G1449><s%> in our hearts, <S%G2588><s%> known <S%G1097><s%> and read <S%G314><s%> of all <S%G3956><s%> men: <S%G444><s%>

For as much as you are manifestly <S%G5319><s%> declared <S%G5319><s%> to be the letter <S%G1992><s%> of Christ <S%G5547><s%> ministered <S%G1247><s%> by us, written <S%G1449><s%> not with ink, <S%G3188><s%> but with the Spirit <S%G4151><s%> of the living <S%G2198><s%> God; <S%G2316><s%> not in tables <S%G4109><s%> of stone, <S%G3035><s%> but in fleshy <S%G4560><s%> tables <S%G4109><s%> of the heart. <S%G2588><s%>
And such <S%G5108><s%> trust <S%G4006><s%> have <S%G2192><s%> we through <S%G1223><s%> Christ <S%G5547><s%> to God-ward: <S%G4314><s%>

Not that we are sufficient <S%G2425><s%> of ourselves <S%G1438><s%> to think <S%G3049><s%> any <S%G5100><s%> thing as of ourselves; <S%G1438><s%> but our sufficiency <S%G2426><s%> is of God; <S%G2316><s%>

Who <S%G3739><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> has made <S%G2427><s%> us able <S%G2427><s%> ministers <S%G1249><s%> of the new <S%G2537><s%> testament; <S%G1242><s%> not of the letter, <S%G1121><s%> but of the spirit: <S%G4151><s%> for the letter <S%G1121><s%> kills, <S%G615><s%> but the spirit <S%G4151><s%> gives life. <S%G2227><s%>

But if <S%G1487><s%> the ministration <S%G1248><s%> of death, <S%G2288><s%> written <S%G1722><s%> <S%G1121><s%> and engraved <S%G1795><s%> in stones, <S%G3037><s%> was glorious, <S%G1722><s%> <S%G1391><s%> so <S%G5620><s%> that the children <S%G5207><s%> of Israel <S%G2474><s%> could <S%G1410><s%> not steadfastly <S%G816><s%> behold <S%G816><s%> the face <S%G4383><s%> of Moses <S%G3475><s%> for the glory <S%G1391><s%> of his countenance; <S%G4383><s%> which <S%G3588><s%> glory <S%G1391><s%> was to be done <S%G2673><s%> away: <S%G2673><s%>
How <S%G4459><s%> shall not the ministration <S%G1248><s%> of the spirit <S%G4151><s%> be rather <S%G3123><s%> glorious? <S%G1722><s%>

For if <S%G1487><s%> the ministration <S%G1248><s%> of condemnation <S%G2633><s%> be glory, <S%G1391><s%> much <S%G4183><s%> more <S%G3123><s%> does the ministration <S%G1248><s%> of righteousness <S%G1343><s%> exceed <S%G4052><s%> in glory. <S%G1391><s%>

For even <S%G2532><s%> that which was made <S%G1392><s%> glorious <S%G1392><s%> had no <S%G3761><s%> glory <S%G1392><s%> in this <S%G5129><s%> respect, <S%G3313><s%> by reason <S%G1752><s%> of the glory <S%G1391><s%> that excels. <S%G5235><s%>

For if <S%G1487><s%> that which is done <S%G2673><s%> away <S%G2673><s%> was glorious, <S%G1223><s%> <S%G1391><s%> much <S%G4183><s%> more <S%G3123><s%> that which remains <S%G3306><s%> is glorious. <S%G1722><s%> <S%G1391><s%>
Seeing then <S%G3767><s%> that we have <S%G2192><s%> such <S%G5108><s%> hope, <S%G1680><s%> we use <S%G5530><s%> great <S%G4183><s%> plainness <S%G3954><s%> of speech:

And not as Moses, <S%G3475><s%> which put <S%G5087><s%> a veil <S%G2571><s%> over <S%G1909><s%> his face, <S%G4383><s%> that the children <S%G5207><s%> of Israel <S%G2474><s%> could not steadfastly <S%G816><s%> look <S%G816><s%> to the end <S%G5056><s%> of that which is abolished: <S%G2673><s%>

But their minds <S%G3540><s%> were blinded: <S%G4456><s%> for until <S%G891><s%> this <S%G4594><s%> day <S%G4594><s%> remains <S%G3306><s%> the same <S%G846><s%> veil <S%G2571><s%> not taken <S%G3361><s%> <S%G348><s%> away <S%G343><s%> in the reading <S%G320><s%> of the old <S%G3820><s%> testament; <S%G1242><s%> which <S%G3748><s%> veil is done <S%G2673><s%> away <S%G2673><s%> in Christ. <S%G5547><s%>
But even <S%G2193><s%> to this <S%G4594><s%> day, <S%G4594><s%> when <S%G2259><s%> Moses <S%G3475><s%> is read, <S%G314><s%> the veil <S%G2571><s%> is on their heart. <S%G2588><s%>
Nevertheless <S%G1161><s%> when <S%G2259><s%> it shall turn <S%G1994><s%> to the Lord, <S%G2962><s%> the veil <S%G2571><s%> shall be taken <S%G4014><s%> away. <S%G4014><s%>
Now <S%G1161><s%> the Lord <S%G2962><s%> is that Spirit: <S%G4151><s%> and where <S%G3757><s%> the Spirit <S%G4151><s%> of the Lord <S%G2962><s%> is, there <S%G1563><s%> is liberty. <S%G1657><s%>

But we all, <S%G3956><s%> with open <S%G343><s%> face <S%G4383><s%> beholding <S%G2734><s%> as in a glass <S%G2734><s%> the glory <S%G1391><s%> of the Lord, <S%G2962><s%> are changed <S%G3339><s%> into the same <S%G846><s%> image <S%G1504><s%> from glory <S%G1391><s%> to glory, <S%G1391><s%> even as by the Spirit <S%G4151><s%> of the LORD. <S%G2962><s%>
